article.headline: UAB 90, South Alabama 75
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) -- Gabe Kennedy scored 19 points, including seven during a key second-half run, to lead UAB to a 90-75 win over South Alabama on Saturday night. Twins Ronell and Donell Taylor scored 11 points apiece, and Mo Finley had 10 for UAB (7-4). Michael Phillips scored 14 points for South Alabama (5-6). Chris Young added 12 points, Malerick Bedden had 11 and Carlos Smith had 10 for the Jaguars. It was the 39th meeting between the two in-state rivals, but the first since 1999. For UAB, it was the 800th game in the program's 25-year history. Both teams played up-tempo, full-court basketball. But UAB took control early, shooting 75 percent from the field in the first half. Kennedy powered inside for eight quick points to help UAB take a 23-8 lead. Donell Taylor scored eight consecutive points to help boost the Blazers' lead to 45-22. The 23-point margin was UAB's biggest of the night, as South Alabama gradually battled back into the game. A 3-pointer by Smith with 9:23 left in the game pulled the Jaguars to within 69-58. But Kennedy scored seven points over the next few minutes to help put UAB back in charge. Ronell Taylor finished with seven rebounds, four assists and two steals for UAB. Bedden had seven rebounds and Shane Spencer handed out six assists for South Alabama.
